doc.title: Q1 first take: EBIT beat, Q2 softer
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/Q1 first take EBIT beat Q2 softerQ1 first take EBIT beat Q2 softer_2025-08-28

passages.text: EBIT beat, sales inline, supported by Europe outperformance. Speaking to co, Q2 softness driven by continued US weakness and China with latter recovery in H2. Tariff 90bps and FX 100bps headwinds to GM with former worsening and latter improving in Q2.

Elekta published its Q1 2025/26 results (ending July) today with net sales broadly in- line with consensus with adj. EBIT \(c + 6.5\%\) ahead and adj. EPS \(c + 12.6\%\) ahead. Gross order intake in the quarter declined \(c - 1\%\) at ccy (vs. \(- 2.1\%\) cons. & \(+10\%\) in Q1 24/25). Speaking to the company, tariffs constituted a 90bps headwind whilst FX was 100bps headwind to gross margin and they expect the former to worsen and the latter to improve in Q2. Chinese sales were negatively impacted by last year's weak order intake, impacting APAC growth which declined \(c - 4\%\) in ccy, with sales in the region expected to start to recover in the second half of 2025/26. Americas' sales also declined by the same amount (although we do note a tough comparison of \(+16\%\) ), with lower sales in North America a drag to growth as U.S. volumes declined mainly as a result of customers awaiting the Elekta Evo clearance. Overall, a better quarter but we expect the focus to be the softer Q2 commentary on the call. We continue to see uncertainty around US Evo approval and expect limited sales from Evo in the US in FY25/26 (see Q4 Review: US orders an overhang, 29 May). We reiterate our UW rating and prefer Siemens Healthineers (Ow) (see: 2025 outlook: 5 themes for '25, 21 Nov 2024).
Conference call today at 09:00 UK time. Dial- in- UK: +44 (0) 207 107 0613; US: +1 (1) 631 570 5613.
European Medical Technology & Services
Price (27- Aug- 25) Potential Upside/Downside Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
This research report has been prepared in whole or in part by equity research analysts based outside the US who are not registered/qualified as research analysts with FINRA.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 4. Completed: 28- Aug- 25, 06:28 GMT Released: 28- Aug- 25, 06:28 GMT Restricted - External
FIGURE 1. Results deviation: actual vs estimates
Source: Barclays Research estimates, Infront consensus (published on 22 August 2025)

Americas: BEAT on net sales versus consensus with cc growth of \(- 4\%\) (vs. Barc \(- 9.6\%\) ). The stable development in Latin America was fully offset by lower sales per region Q1 sales in North America where U.S. volumes declined mainly as a result of customers awaiting the Elekta Evo clearance. BEAT on Adj. EBIT relative to Barclays estimates.

EMEA: BEAT on net sales versus consensus with cc growth of \(+15\%\) (vs. Barc \(+8.1\%\) ). The development was mainly driven by continued strong momentum in Europe supported by new product launches. BEAT on Adj. EBIT relative to Barclays estimates.

- APAC: MISS on net sales versus consensus with cc growth of \(-4\%\) (vs. Barc \(+4.6\%\) ) mainly due to lower volumes in China and India. Chinese sales were negatively impacted by last year's weak order into Asia. MISS on Adj. EBIT relative to Barclays estimates.

- Net sales for Elekta are expected to grow year over year for the full year of 2025/26 (vs. cons \(+4.3\%\) ) with Gross margin improvement (vs. cons. -10bps) as well as EBIT margin improvement (vs. cons. +10bps) driven by price increases, product launches and volumes, resulting in a stepwise improvement towards midterm targets.
- Beyond 2025/26, the company expects EBIT margin expanding to \(14\%\) and higher (vs. cons. \(12.9\%\) in FY 28/29E) and gross margin to above \(40\%\) (pre-pandemic levels).

- For Q2 2025/26, they expect a negative impact from continued weak US development and last year's low order intake in China. Sales in China are expected to recover in H2. FX and tariffs will continue to negatively affect earnings in Q2.

I, Hassan Al- Wakeel, CFA, hereby certify (1) that the views expressed in this research report accurately reflect my personal views about any or all of the subject securities or issuers referred to in this research report and (2) no part of my compensation was, is or will be directly or indirectly related to the specific recommendations or views expressed in this research report.
Elekta AB (EKTAB.ST, 27- Aug- 2025, SEK 48.94), Underweight/Positive, J
Siemens Healthineers AG (SHLG.DE, 27- Aug- 2025, EUR 47.19), Overweight/Positive, A/D/E/J/K/L/M/N

Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Positive - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
Neutral - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Negative - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.

Stock Rating: UNDERWEIGHT  Industry View: POSITIVE  Closing Price: SEK 48.94 (27-Aug-2025)

\*This is the closing price referenced in the publication, which may not be the last available closing price at the time of publication.
Historical stock prices and price targets may have been adjusted for stock splits and dividends.

Valuation Methodology: We derive our PT for Elekta using a blend of c.12x PE and 8x EV/EBITDA on Apr'26E, or a c.30% discount to peers, which we see as justified given a poor track record of execution and downside risk to margins over the medium term. We sense check with DCF.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: i) An improvement in the US market and some evidence of market share gains; ii) improved mix and margins; iii) significant traction in new product launches, particularly Unity.
Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT  Industry View: POSITIVE  Closing Price: EUR 47.19 (27-Aug-2025)
Rating and Price Target Chart - EUR (as of 27-Aug-2025)  Currency= EUR
Source: IDC, Barclays Research  Link to Barclays Live for interactive charting
On 28-Aug-2022, prior to any intra-day change that may have been published, the rating for this security was Overweight, and the adjusted price target was 64.00.
Source: Bloomberg, Barclays Research
*This is the closing price referenced in the publication, which may not be the last available closing price at the time of publication.
Historical stock prices and price targets may have been adjusted for stock splits and dividends.

**Valuation Methodology:** We derive our price target based on a blend of 2025E P/E (29x) and EV/EBITDA (16x) multiples, representing a c.8% premium to MedTech peers. We believe SHL is a high-quality name that warrants a premium, supported by its strong fundamentals and long-term growth prospects. We sense-check with DCF and SoTP, which yield similar results.

**Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target:** Risks include the integration of the VAR deal,execution of the diagnostics turnaround, margin pressure, cuts to hospital capex as well as competition.
